itemDescription: English television presenter and lesbian rights activist (1926-1998)

wikipedia_page.main: Jackie Forster (née Jacqueline Moir Mackenzie; 6 November 1926 – 10 October 1998) was an English news reporter, actress and lesbian rights activist.

response: *Jackie Forster, actress, TV personality, feminist and lesbian campaigner

Arena Three was largely written by the same group of women and was often accused of being too middle class. It graduated from a type-written newsletter to a full glossy magazine by 1971. Maureen Duffy and Jackie Forster became regular contributors. A recent review of the magazine by Brighton Ourstory describes its contents as including letters from women around the country discussing local dances, events and the gay and lesbian politics of the day.

The MRG ended with the final issue of Arena Three, which was published in March 1972. Former group member Jackie Forster went on to start Sappho magazine in the same year. Jackie also went on to become an Executive member of the Campaign for Homosexual Equality and the Gay Liberation Front along with other former MRG members such as Maureen Duffy.
* Jackie Forster was a broadcaster, an active member and wrote for Arena Three.
Jackie Forster reported being able to distribute Sappho magazine and advertise Sappho's events in the Gateways.
* Jackie Forster, actress, TV personality and lesbian campaigner
* Jackie Forster (Jacqueline Moir Mackenzie) – actress, TV personality, feminist and lesbian campaigner
The winner of this award is nominated by Glasgow Women's Library. The award is a memorial to Jackie Forster.

The old Centre included a cafe/bar, four offices which were rented to LGBT-friendly businesses, and two meeting rooms called the Jackie Forster Memorial Room and the Ian Dunn Memorial Room. It was regularly used by many LGBT community groups for meetings and events.

response: * Jackie Forster (1926–1998), TV reporter and member of the Minorities Research Group
Sappho was an English lesbian social club founded in 1972 by Jackie Forster and others.
Lorenzo was best known for managing talents like Judy Ann Santos, Karla Estrada, Jackie Forster, Gretchen Barretto and Sunshine Cruz, among others.
*Jackie Forster, 71, English news reporter, actress and lesbian rights activist.
